data.text: a list (as of bibliographical information or citations to a body of literature) arranged usually in alphabetical order of some specified datum (such as author, subject, or keyword): such as
examples: 3 is the index of the expression \sqrt[3] to indicate the cube root of 5

data.text: a list of items (such as topics or names) treated in a printed work that gives for each item the page number where it may be found
examples: 3 is the index of the expression \sqrt[3] to indicate the cube root of 5

data.text: a list of publicly traded companies and their stock prices
examples: 3 is the index of the expression \sqrt[3] to indicate the cube root of 5

data.text: the ratio multiplied by 100 of the maximum breadth from side to side of the head to its maximum length from front to back in living individuals
to index (an item) under a second or under more than one heading
to supply with a cross-referenced index
a value that indicates what the ambient temperature feels like to the human body and that is derived from a calculation using air temperature and relative humidity
examples: The most likely chances for a heat advisory are Thursday and Friday, when the heat index could approach at least 100 degrees, according to National Weather Service meteorologists â€¦

The heat index is defined as a function of temperature and relative humidity. The combination of the two results in an apparent temperature that gives an idea of what the hot and humid air feels like to the average person.

data.text: a measure of the relative desirability of a drug for the attaining of a particular medical end that is usually expressed as the ratio of the largest dose producing no toxic symptoms to the smallest dose routinely producing cures
